page.title: 18Children in Wytham
page.content: Nineteen children live in Wytham.They form 14% of the total population,and range from 6 months to 16 years of age. Girls predominate in the older age group, and boys in the younger. As there is no school in Wytham, a Parents' Association was recently formed to bring the children together socially. Hallowe'en and Bonfire Night parties, Christmas concerts, Easter cards, May celebrations, summer picnics and walks are organised. Sundays bring an opportunity for singing, or playing a musical instrument in the church choir or attending Sunday School. Whether they live in the Abbey, the lock, the farm or one of the cottages, the children enjoy the peaceful country life. A bus to school and having a small group of friends are more than compensated for by country pleasures.
